Technique: FORMED ON THE POTTER'S WHEEL; ENGOBE; PAINTED
Name: Vase
Description: Small vase, truncate-cone shaped, with a wide mouth, rounded rim and more or less straight walls. Stable flat-bottomed base. Orangey-coloured paste and interior and exterior surface covered with a reddish-coloured coating. On the rim, both inner and outer, traces are to be seen of a painted line of a dark red colour. On the inside, below the rim, we find a double striation.
